description: One of {open, replay, prediction, closed}. Determines how outputs were generated (teacher-forced vs noisy drive vs free rollouts).
Full path to the evaluated checkpoint (.pth.tar).
If open-loop used an external dataset, this is its path; empty otherwise.
Standard deviation of Gaussian noise used to drive inputs in replay or the non-prefix part of prediction (unitless).
Number of initial time steps driven by the ground-truth input (prediction/closed).
Angular error threshold (degrees) used to declare divergence (prediction/closed).
How many consecutive time steps must exceed the threshold to count as divergence.
How outputs are mapped back to inputs during closed-loop rollouts: {prob, none}.
Length of autonomous rollout after the warm-up in closed-loop evaluation.
Mean over batch×time×features of (target - output)^2.
Mean Pearson r across features after flattening batch×time.
Resultant-length concentration of phase error Δθ; higher is better (1=perfect, 0=uniform).
1 - R; lower is better.
Lag-1 autocorrelation of stepwise residual norms.
Mean L2 norm of (Target-Output) across time and batch.
Linear (ridge) decode of [cosθ, sinθ] from model outputs; mean R^2 of the two heads.
First time the mean |Δθ| stays ≥ threshold for div_consec steps; None/blank if not reached.
Slope (rad/step) of the unwrapped mean signed Δθ over time.
MSE computed only on the autonomous (free) part of a closed-loop rollout; blank for other modes.
Mean feature correlation on the free segment (closed-loop only).
R computed on free segment (closed-loop only).
1-R on the free segment (closed-loop only).
Lag-1 autocorr of residual norms on free segment (closed-loop only).
Mean residual L2 on free segment (closed-loop only).
Mean R^2 for [cosθ, sinθ] decode on free segment (closed-loop only).
